question.text: Which is the correct statement in the following?

options.text: The coordination number of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> ion in <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math> is <math><mn>4</mn></math>

The unit cell having crystal parameters, <math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>≠</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi></math> <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">γ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup></math> is hexagonal
The ionic crystal of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></math> has only Schottky defect

In ionic compounds having Frenkel defect the ratio <math><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">γ</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">γ</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></math> is high

solution.text:
A crystal system is hexagonal if its unit cell having a=b≠c axial ratio and
α=β=90°, γ=120° axial angles. Crystal of AgBr has both Schottky defect and Frenkel defect. Frenkel defect is shown by ionic solid having low coordination number.
